title: Quarkus 3.0.0.CR2 : DevUI error with custom root path
body:
### Describe the bug

After migrating an application with a custom root path (`quarkus.http.root-path`) to Quarkus 3.0.0.CR2 the expected redirect from http://localhost:8080/my-root-path/q/dev to http://localhost:8080/my-root-path/q/dev-ui is not working. 

Furthermore, trying to access the DevUI at http://localhost:8080/my-root-path/q/dev-ui also fails due too missing components (for example, HTTP 404 accessing http://localhost:8080/_static/es-module-shims/dist/es-module-shims.js)

It seems like the root path it's ignored during the building of the new DevUI

### Expected behavior

DevUI should be also available for applications with a custom root path 

### Actual behavior

DevUI is currently not available for applications using Quarkus 3.00.CR2 and a custom root path

### How to Reproduce?

Using the https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/getting-started service:

1. Manually migrate from current 2.16.6.Final to version 3.0.0.CR2 or applying the available OpenRewrite migration recipe as described here https://quarkus.io/blog/quarkus-3-0-0-cr2-released/#automated-migration
2. Configure a custom root path. For example `quarkus.http.root-path=/my-root-path/`
3. Start the application in dev mode `mvn quarkus:dev`
4. Access the DevUI pressing `d` or accessing http://localhost:8080/my-root-path/q/dev-ui or http://localhost:8080/my-root-path/q/dev
